passage_text: The cost of living in Florida (FL) is lower than the nationwide average. The average yearly pay in Florida is $43,649.00, which is lower than the U.S. average annual salary by $6,159.00. The consumer price index (CPI) of 232 in Florida is 0.43% lower than the U.S. city average CPI of 233. The sales tax is 6.00%.

1 The cost of living in Orlando is 1 % less than the Florida average. 2  The cost of living in Orlando is 0.3 % greater than the national average. 3  Each cost of living index is based on a national average of 100. 4  If the amount is below 100, it is low

COST OF LIVING OVERVIEW. Our cost of living indices are based on a US average of 100. An amount below 100 means Florida, Florida is cheaper than the US average. A cost of living index above 100 means Florida, Florida is more expensive. Overall, Florida, Florida cost of living is 98.70.
